issue.title: [CF 691] Allow icons to react to UI error messages
issue.body:
I would like to create a set of icons which will flash different warnings depending on whether an ability is:
1. Simply out of range
2. Not facing the right way
3. Being parried

The combat log differentiates these via parenthetical notations:
1. X failed. (Out of range)
2. X failed. (Target needs to be in front of you)
3. X missed Y. (Parried)

And the UI displays errors such as:
"Target needs to be in front of you" (failed special attacks)
"You are facing the wrong way" (failed auto-attacks)

The "range" check is simple and easy in TMW. However, I can't figure out a way to make TellMeWhen parse out the 2nd and 3rd conditions. I can check Combat Events for "Swing Miss", but this will include normal Misses as well as Dodges, neither of which warn me that I'm in front of the target. And I can't find any way to react to the red error text that spams the screen when you're doing something wrong.

I'm not quite sure whether this would belong in a new icon, an increase in Combat Event's detail level, a new Condition type ("Error message"), or something else. It would have interesting uses, though.


> Posted by CurseForge user Lov3star | Imported from CurseForge issue #691 | Raw

comments.body:
The reason why I haven't done this yet is that I'm also "not quite sure whether this would belong in a new icon, an increase in Combat Event's detail level, a new Condition type ("Error message"), or something else".

It doesn't really fit well into TellMeWhen.

  • An extension of the Combat Event icon type doesn't really work because that excludes all messages obtained through UI_ERROR_MESSAGE (the red text in the top-center of your screen).
  • An icon type would be required in order to expose the error message through to a DogTag tag so that you could display it as text on the icon.
    • It would also require some sort of timing mechanism to determine how long to show the icon for after the error happens (like condition icons use).
  • A condition implementation would also require some sort of a timer, as well as a message filter.
  • In either a condition or an icon type implementation, there might have to be some kind of throttle or "spam" filter to prevent occasions where an error message is presented many times consecutively.

There are other reasons why this would be a difficult fit for TellMeWhen, but these are the main ones. I think I am going to have to say no to this feature request.


> Posted by CurseForge user Cybeloras
